Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using http.server in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Python class that implements an HTTP server for sharing and viewing log files from a specified directory. The server should handle GET requests to display available log files and serve their contents.

Class Description: The LogServer class creates an HTTP server that serves log files from a specified directory. It uses a custom request handler (LogSharedHandler) to process HTTP requests and serve either a directory listing or file contents.

Attributes:
- log_path: str - The directory path where log files are stored
- port: int - The port number on which the HTTP server will listen
- httpd: Optional[HTTPServer] - The HTTP server instance (None until started)

Methods:
- __init__(log_path: str, port: int) -> None - Initializes the LogServer with the specified log directory path and port number
- start() -> None - Starts the HTTP server on 0.0.0.0 (all interfaces) using the specified port and serves requests indefinitely

The LogSharedHandler (inner class) handles HTTP requests with these methods:
- do_GET() -> None - Processes GET requests:
  - For root path ("/"), returns an HTML page listing all available log files as clickable links
  - For specific file paths, returns the content of the requested log file
  - Returns 404 if requested file doesn't exist
